## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

```{r}
# start out with a number to test
x <- 5
# you'll want your function to return this number
x^2
square <- function (z) {
	squared_value <-	z*z
	return(squared_value)
	}
	z <- 6
	z*z
	
	square(17)


add_two_numbers <- function (y, w) {
	add_values <- y + w
	return (add_values)
}
add_two_numbers (4,6)

add_three_numbers <- function (a,b,c) {
		add_values <- a+b+c
		return (add_values)
}
add_three_numbers (42,53,78)


```
#raise function
raise <- function (x,power) {
raise <- (x^power)
return (raise)
}

raise (x=3, power=3)
raise (x=7, power=4)

#default raise function
raise <- function (x, power=2) {
raise <- (x^2)
return (raise)
}

raise (x=5)
